intro: Crotalaria streptorrhyncha, commonly known as the spurred crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in racemes, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that can grow up to 1 meter in height, with hairy stems and yellowish-green foliage. Crotalaria streptorrhyncha is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique floral structure and growth habit.
